intro: Corymborkis confusa, commonly known as the confused corymborkis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Its unique floral structure makes it an interesting subject for botanical study and horticultural cultivation.
